title: TOSCA - Timing Of Somatic Copy number Alterations
text: TOSCA packege inferring timing real time clonal subclonal somatic copy numbers (SCNA) type 2:0, 2:1 2:2, driver events altering mutation rate. input data result clonal signature deconvolution analyses performed WGS longitudinal data.

title: TOSCA - Timing Of Somatic Copy number Alterations
text: use TOSCA, please cite: * Timing cancer genomics driver events around therapy Riccardo Bergamin, Alice Antonello, Giulio Caravagna.

what: Infer the timing of the events of interest fitting the appropriate TOSCA model — fit
title: Infer the timing of the events of interest fitting the appropriate TOSCA model — fit
text: Infer timing events interest fitting appropriate TOSCA model

title: Infer the timing of the events of interest fitting the appropriate TOSCA model — fit
code: fit(   x,   n_iterations = 10000,   n_chains = 4,   warm_up = 5000,   cores = 4,   adapt_delta = 0.95,   stepsize = 0.01,   seed = 5,   model_name = "Driver",   dormancy = F,   verbose = F,   initialisation = F,   init_fun = NULL,   max_mrca = NA,   reg_dormancy = 0 )

title: Infer the timing of the events of interest fitting the appropriate TOSCA model — fit
text: x TOSCA object n_iterations Number iteration MCMC chain. default 10000. n_chains positive integer specifying number Markov chains. default 4. warm_up positive integer specifying number warmup (aka burnin) iterations per chain. default 5000. cores Number cores use executing chains parallel adapt_delta target acceptance probability Metropolis step HMC. default 0.95. seed seed computation. Default 5. model_name Name model: "CNA" "Driver" dormancy Boolean specifying model include dormancy (available "CNA" model). default F verbose Boolen specifying fit function output iterations progression. default F. step_size far particle moves leapfrog step along trajectory. default 0.01.

title: Infer the timing of the events of interest fitting the appropriate TOSCA model — fit

title: Title — get_name_mu_step
Initialise TOSCA object — init
Initialise TOSCA object — init
Initialise TOSCA object — init
text: mutations data.frame information mutation falling timed branches. 1. Name (str), name choosing cluster mutations 2. Length (int), length genomic segment sit 3. Karyptype (str), karyotype genomic segment sit "Major:minor" (ex "1:1") 4. Type (str), one following: "clock-like primary", "clock-like relapse", "alpha", "beta", "driver", name mutagenic drug associated reported therapies dataframe 5. Value (int), number mutations parameters data.frame parameters required inference. 1. Name (str), 2. Value (real), 3. Index (int) samples data.frame name collection date longitudinal samples + date birth (optional). 1. Name (str), name sample 2. Date (date) date collection format "YYYY-mm-dd" therapies data.frame name exposure period therapies affecting mutation accumulation process. 1. Name (str) 2. Class (str), one following : "Mutagenic step", "Mutagenic cauchy", "Driver responsive", "Chemotherapy inducing dormancy" 3. Start (date), start cicle therapy format "YYYY-mm-dd" 4. End (date), end cicle therapy format "YYYY-mm-dd"

title: Initialise TOSCA object — init
Initialise TOSCA object — init
code: library(TOSCA) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) data("exampleData_CNA") mutations = exampleData_CNA$Mutations parameters = exampleData_CNA$Parameters samples = exampleData_CNA$Samples therapies = exampleData_CNA$Therapies  x = init(mutations=mutations, samples=samples, therapies=therapies, parameters=parameters) #> Warning: The following mutations do not follow the conventional naming scheme: Drug 1 , Drug 2. If these mutations are associated to a therapy-related mutational process, make sure that the name reported in 'Type' is the same as the one reported in the 'Therapy' dataframe for the corresponding mutational process. If that is not the case, please choose a valid mutation type between the following: clock-like primary , clock-like relapse , alpha , beta , driver
